feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 17 at 4:31AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Light Snow This Morning... Snow has fallen overnight with just over an inch in many areas. Light snow will continue this morning and then taper off to flurries this afternoon. Most areas can expect expect a storm total of 2 inches by noon today, with little additional accumulation after noon.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Chatanika River Valley; Delta Junction; Eielson AFB and Salcha; Fairbanks Metro Area; Goldstream Valley and Nenana Hills; Nenana; Tanana Flats; Two Rivers; Upper Chena River Valley; White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 17 at 4:13AM AKST until November 17 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with reduced visibility. Additional snow accumulations of one to 2 inches. entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Brooks Range

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 16 at 6:12PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FALLING TEMPERATURES CREATING ICY ROAD CONDITIONS OVERNIGHT... Temperatures will fall below freezing tonight and continue to fall into the teens and 20s by Friday morning. This will allow the development of black ice to form on wet roadways and other hard surfaces. Any standing water or slushy conditions will also quickly refreeze overnight. If travelling, be prepared for rapid
entry.cap:areaDesc: Anchorage; Matanuska Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula

entry.summary: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Florida... entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 17 at 2:37AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Impacts to the Friday Morning Commute... Strong southwest to west winds, with gusts of between 40 to 70 mph, are expected to persist through the Friday morning commute along the Rocky Mountain Front. In addition to strong cross winds travelers should be prepared for the potential of blowing and drifting snow, especially in prone areas.
entry.cap:areaDesc: East Glacier Park Region; Northern High Plains; Southern High Plains; Southern Rocky Mountain Front

entry.summary: ...LOCALLY DENSE FOG AND PATCHY FROST DURING THE COMMUTE THIS MORNING... entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Portland Metro Area; Lower Columbia

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued November 17 at 8:04AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... Virginia Department of Environmental Quality has issued a Code Orange Air Quality Alert for Fine Particulates for Augusta, Rockingham, Shenandoah, Page, Warren, Frederick, Clarke, Nelson, and Albemarle Counties in Virginia, as well as Berkeley, Jefferson, and Morgan Counties in West Virginia until midnight EST.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Albemarle; Augusta; Central Virginia Blue Ridge; Clarke; Frederick; Nelson; Northern Virginia Blue Ridge; Page; Rockingham; Shenandoah; Warren

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued November 17 at 7:35AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... The Virginia Department of Environmental Quality has issued a health alert through today and tonight due to unhealthy particle concentrations due to smoke from multiple wildfires across the Commonwealth. The counties affected are: Rockbridge, Bedford, and Amherst. Air quality in those areas ranges from Code Orange to
entry.cap:areaDesc: Amherst; Bedford; Rockbridge

entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Life-threatening rip currents due to a long period northerly swell. entry.cap:areaDesc: St.Thomas...St. John.. and Adjacent Islands

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 17 at 5:28AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...LOCALLY DENSE FOG AND PATCHY FROST DURING THE COMMUTE THIS MORNING... Shallow dense fog has developed along much of the Lower Columbia, Cowlitz, and Willamette Rivers early this morning, reducing visibility to as low as a few hundred feet in some locations. The dense fog is impacting portions of the Interstate 5 corridor in
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Vancouver Area; Lower Columbia and I - 5 Corridor in Cowlitz County

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 17 at 3:15AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...AREAS OF DENSE FOG THROUGH 8AM THIS MORNING... Localized dense fog will continue across portions of southeast Wyoming this morning. While the dense fog is not widespread, it is locally dense with visibilities under one quarter mile observed in the North Platte River Valley of Goshen and Platte Counties, the Niobrara River Valley of Niobrara County, and the Cheyenne Ridge
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Laramie County; East Laramie County; East Platte County; Goshen County; Niobrara County
